verse.roman:
dadhyaṅṅ ātharvaṇas tvaṣṭre
varmābhedyaṁ mad-ātmakam
viśvarūpāya yat prādāt
tvaṣṭā yat tvam adhās tataḥ

synonyms: dadhyaṅ—Dadhyañca; ātharvaṇaḥ—the son of Atharvā; tvaṣṭre—unto Tvaṣṭā; varma—the protective covering known as Nārāyaṇa-kavaca; abhedyam—invincible; mat-ātmakam—consisting of Myself; viśvarūpāya—unto Viśvarūpa; yat—which; prādāt—delivered; tvaṣṭā—Tvaṣṭā; yat—which; tvam—you; adhāḥ—received; tataḥ—from him.
translation: Dadhyañca's invincible protective covering known as the Nārāyaṇa-kavaca was given to Tvaṣṭā, who delivered it to his son Viśvarūpa, from whom you have received it. Because of this Nārāyaṇa-kavaca, Dadhīci's body is now very strong. You should therefore beg him for his body.
